Package org.apache.tamaya.spisupport.propertysource

Class BasePropertySource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.tamaya.spisupport.propertysource.BasePropertySource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PropertySource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CLIPropertySource, EnvironmentPropertySource, JavaConfigurationPropertySource, MapPropertySource, PropertiesResourcePropertySource, SimplePropertySource, SimplePropertySource, SystemPropertySource
    public abstract class BasePropertySource
extends Object
implements PropertySource
    Abstract PropertySource that allows setting a default ordinal to be used, if no ordinal is provided with the config.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.apache.tamaya.spi.PropertySource

      • setOrdinal

        public void setOrdinal​(Integer ordinal)
        Allows setting the ordinal of this property source explicitly. This will override any evaluated ordinal, or default ordinal. To reset an explicit ordinal call setOrdinal(null);.
        Parameters:
        ordinal - the explicit ordinal, or null.

      • setDefaultOrdinal

        Parameters:
        defaultOrdinal - the default ordinal, or null.

      • getOrdinal

        public int getOrdinal()
        Description copied from interface: PropertySource
        The ordinal value is the default ordering parameter which definines the default order of auto-discovered property sources. Ordering of property sources is important since values from property sources with higher ordinal values override values from less significant property sources. By default Tamaya includes the following property sources:
        1. Properties file values (/META-INF/javaconfiguration.properties) (ordinal 100)
        2. JNDI values (ordinal 200, only when adding the tamaya-jndi extension module)
        3. Environment properties (ordinal 300)
        4. System properties (ordinal 1000)

        Important Hints for custom implementations:

        If a custom implementation should be invoked before the default implementations, use a value > 1000

        If a custom implementation should be invoked after the default implementations, use a value < 100

        Reordering of the default order of the config-sources:

        Example: If the properties file/s should be used before the other implementations, you have to configure an ordinal > 1000. That means, you have to addPropertyValue e.g. tamaya.ordinal=401 to /META-INF/javaconfiguration.properties . Hint: In case of property files every file is handled as independent config-source, but all of them have ordinal 400 by default (and can be reordered in a fine-grained manner.

        In cases where it is not possible to change a config sources ordinal value, you may have several options:
        • you can use a ConfigurationBuilder to redefine the source order and finally use ConfigurationProvider.setConfiguration(Configuration) to change the current default Configuration.
        • finally, the implementor of this API may define alternate mechanism to reconfigure an ordinal in a vendor specific way.
        Specified by:
        getOrdinal in interface PropertySource
        Returns:
        the 'importance' aka ordinal of the configured values. The higher, the more important.

      • getDefaultOrdinal

        public int getDefaultOrdinal()
        Returns the default ordinal used, when no ordinal is setCurrent, or the ordinal was not parseable to an int createValue.
        Returns:
        the default ordinal used, by default 0.

        public ChangeSupport getChangeSupport()
        Description copied from interface: PropertySource
